content.title: Promotion And Development Of Tea Tourism Infrastructure In Assam
content.beneficiary: Private Tea Garden companies and leaseholders
content.details: The scheme aims to develop 50 selective Tea Gardens as tourism destinations in Assam, enhancing the overall experience for tourists with modern amenities and activities such as trekking, tea-testing, and visiting tea factories. The scheme will also focus on preserving the environment and creating employment opportunities.
benefits: Upgrade existing tourist infrastructure of the Tea Garden
Encourage private tea companies to promote tea tourism
Develop modern amenities to attract global tourists
Enhance coordination among tea stakeholders and state tourist operators
Promote tea tourism activities like plucking tea leaves, nature walks, and trekking
Highlight cultural and socio-economic aspects of the Tea Tribes of Assam
Promote local traditions including food, attire, and handicrafts
eligibility: Private Tea Garden companies’ Garden owners can apply
Leaseholders can apply if the lease period is a minimum of 15 years
Tea Garden company/Garden owner/lease holder must be willing to undertake a tea tourism scheme
Ideal size of tea garden should be 50 hectares or above (25 hectares for hill districts)
Tea Gardens must be free from disputes, encroachment, and pollution
Preference for gardens near reserved forests, wildlife sanctuaries, and major tourist destinations
Assistance only for renovation of iconic bungalows and new tourism infrastructures
Preference for employment-related activities in tea tourism
content.application_process: Offline application process through Assam Tourism Development Corporation Ltd. with prescribed format and supporting documents.
documents_required: No objection certificate from circle officer/DC
Proper land documents of the tea garden
Site plan of the tea garden
Balance sheets for the last five years

faqs.question: What is the scope of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide an overall experience for tourists in the midst of a tea garden with accommodation facilities and various activities.

faqs.question: What kind of activities will be promoted under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Activities such as plucking tea leaves, nature walks, trekking, rafting, and golf will be promoted.

faqs.question: Does this scheme focus on the Tea tribes of Assam?
faqs.answer: Yes, it focuses on the cultural and socio-economic scenario of the Tea Tribes of Assam.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Private Tea Garden companies and leaseholders are eligible.

faqs.question: Will any preference be given to the Tea Garden under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, preference will be given to iconic/heritage gardens and those near major tourist destinations.
